itemLabel: Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty

wikipedia_page.main: William Francis Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty, 7th Marquess of Heusden (18 September 1911 – 18 May 1995) was a prominent ufologist.  He was an Irish peer, as well as a nobleman in the Dutch nobility.

response: * Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty - 1974 proponent of Hollow Earth

* Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty (1911-1995), prominent ufologist

In 1995 he succeeded to the titles on the death of his childless uncle, Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty. He took his seat in the House of Lords at this time as Viscount Clancarty, a title in the Peerage of the United Kingdom, because titles in the Peerage of Ireland did not entitle their holders to sit even before the House of Lords Act 1999 removed the majority of the hereditary peers.
#REDIRECT Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty

Several writers have offered paranormal explanations for the story. Morris K. Jessup and Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty, suggested alien abduction, while Colin Wilson and Gary Blackwood suggested teleportation.
*Brinsley Le Poer Trench, 8th Earl of Clancarty, 83, Irish peer and proponent of the Hollow Earth concept.
